section.p: You have reached the landing site of the ActiveQuant securities trading framework. University? We would be happy to support you and your students on your voyage into quantitative finance! What about a guest lecture?

This project is an open source project, but not free software, but it is provided free of charge to academics and hobbyists. You could also say it is an open core software. We provide various commercial services around this open core.
Our people are available for consulting, please contact Ulrich to get in touch with us to make your security trading happen.

section.name: Typical use cases
section.p: Typical use cases for this project include recording large volume timeseries, managing financial reference data and other information. You can also backtest and run trading systems in production. You might also want to plug in applications written in other languages through a SOAP Service Facade or Matlab to access that data. It is also possible simulate trading, high frequency and low frequency and to move seamlessly from simulation to production through one of the trading venue interface implementations.

section.name: A personal message
section.p: This framework follows the KISS principle as close as possible. In case you wonder why something was done that way and not another, keep KISS in mind.

Another topic, checkstyle. Use it as a hint, but don't take it serious. Things like whitespace warnings and hiding variable names in constructors are something for interns that have nothing else to do. If you have some time, clean things up.

Use this framework in simulation as long as you need to and purchase one of the external interfaces to link it to the real world. Of course you are free to distribute and publish your own external connectors, if you let something flow back to us. Please keep our license in mind.
